src:
Martinovi ščitniki za svetovne zvezdnike
Nekdanji mladi nogometni reprezentant ni bil zadovoljen s ščitniki, zato se je odločil, da jih naredi sam. Postaja igralec na globalnem trgu.
01 Nov 2019, 11:27 by Drago Perko



Martin igra nogomet in dela ščitnike. FOTO: OSEBNI ARHIV M. Š.



Tudi kapetanka ženske reprezentance Mateja Zver prisega na Martinove izdelke. FOTO: OSEBNI ARHIV M. Š.



Igralke in igralci se odločajo za različne motive. FOTO: OSEBNI ARHIV M. Š.


Nogometaši in nogometašice dobro vedo, kako pomembni so ščitniki, verjetno pa ni toliko znano, da jih izdeluje tudi nekdanji mladi reprezentant Slovenije Martin Šušteršič. Pa ne le zase in prijatelje, ampak za ves svet!


Tudi kapetanka ženske reprezentance Mateja Zver prisega na Martinove izdelke. FOTO: OSEBNI ARHIV M. Š.

»S tistimi, ki sem jih nosil, nisem bil nikoli res zadovoljen. Bili so debeli, okorni, težki, med igro so me ovirali, nikakor niso ostali na mestu. Že pri štirinajstih letih sem si začel izdelovati improvizirane. Preizkusil sem vse mogoče materiale in oblike in z leti so ščitniki postajali vse boljši. Tako se je začelo,« nam pove 26-letni igralec, ki je sprva igral v kranjskem Triglavu, zdaj brca v Avstriji (v ekipi ATUS Ferlach). 
Radoveden otrok
»Že od nekdaj me je zanimalo, kako stvari delujejo, zato sem že kot otrok razstavljal in sestavljal elektronske aparate in druge stvari, ki so ležale doma, mislim, da sem tukaj pridobil prve ročne spretnosti. Naši ščitniki so izdelani ročno, zato sta pri izdelavi potrebna izjemna natančnost in predvsem potrpljenje. Za razvoj izdelka sem porabil dobri dve leti, medtem sem preizkusil nešteto različnih materialov in norih idej in se ogromno naučil. Pri njihovem razvoju mi je pomagalo podjetje iz Tržiča, ki izdeluje čevlje, vložke in druge stvari po meri kupcev,« razkrije.Od Arsenala do PortlandaSead Kolašinac (Arsenal), Milot Rashica, Niclas Fülkrug, Leonardo Bittencourt (vsi Werder Bremen), Žan Majer (US Lecce), Adam Gnezda Čerin (FC Nuremberg), Jan Mlakar (QPR), Lovro Bizjak (FK Ufa), Blaž Kramer (FC Zürich), Marko Rog (Cagliari), Aljaz Ivačič (Portland Timbers), Senijad Ibričić, Rudi Požeg Vancaš, Blaž Vrhovec, Mario Jurčević, Slobodan Vuk, Tadej Vidmajer, Gregor Sikošek, Aljaž Krefl, Tilen Mlakar, Žan Benedičič,Tom Žurga, Kristjan Arh Česen, Goran Brkić, Luka Bobičanec, Klemen Šturm je nekaj imen, ki uporabljajo Martinove ščitnike.»4kickerz nogometni ščitniki so izdelani ročno. Izdelava personaliziranih ščitnikov je zelo specifična. Največ časa (več kot polovico) porabimo za izdelavo dizajna (grafik). Odvisno od zahtevnosti dizajna, ki si ga zaželi stranka, je za izdelavo enega para ščitnikov potrebno od ure in pol do dveh ur in pol,« pove. 
Pametna pena
Izvedeli smo, da se v Sloveniji z izdelavo ščitnikov po naročilu ukvarja še eno podjetje. Njihovo podjetje jih izdeluje iz karbona na podlagi 3D-skeniranja noge. »V nasprotju z običajnimi ščitniki, ki so trdi in togi, so naši izdelani iz pametne pene, imenovane poron XRD. Njena posebnost je, da se molekule pri udarcu v peno stisnejo skupaj in pena iz mehkega in fleksibilnega stanja v hipu postane trda in absorbira silo udarca. Ker so ščitniki v normalnem stanju fleksibilni, se popolnoma prilagodijo nogi nogometaša, zato ima ta občutek, da jih sploh ne nosi, in mislim da je to ključno, zakaj si mojih želi vedno več igralcev iz najboljših nogometnih klubov in lig,« pravi o tem, zakaj so njegovi nekaj posebnega.Družina, simboli, živaliIgralke in igralci imajo različne želje, kaj bi radi imeli na njih. Veliko jih da na njih sliko svoje družine in prijateljev, za popestritev dizajna uporabljajo najrazličnejše simbole, živali, motivacijske reke, številke, datume.Podjetju, ki izdeluje to peno, je predstavil svojo idejo, in čeprav tako majhnih količin dejansko ne izdelujejo, so ga podprli! Na notranji strani uporabljajo posebno blago, na katerega je s 3D-tiskom natisnjena posebna snov, ki preprečuje, da bi ščitniki drseli po nogi. »4kickerz so eni najlažjih nogometnih ščitnikov na trgu,« poudari Martin in pove, da mu je pri razvoju pomagalo več podjetij in ljudi. Trenutno okoli osemdeset odstotkov dela opravi sam. 
Iz hobija posel
»Če bo šlo tako naprej, bom kmalu potreboval izdatno pomoč,« optimistično napove. »V tem trenutku že lahko rečem, da je projekt prerasel okvire hobija, vendar se še ne počutim, kot da bi bila to moja služba, saj izjemno uživam. Skoraj vsak teden dobim nov zagon in motivacijo, ko me svetovno znani nogometaši pokličejo, da bi želeli preizkusiti moje ščitnike. Prejšnji teden jih je naročil Mesut Özil, tako da res ne vem, kje je sploh meja mojega projekta,« je upravičeno ponosen.
40–80​evrov stanejo ščitniki.
»Za zdaj se glas o naših ščitnikih širi predvsem od ust do ust. Ko jih nekdo iz ekipe naroči, po navadi dobimo še 3, 4 naročila iz nje. Velika prednost je tudi, da jih nosijo nogometaši iz angleške Preimer league in nemške Bundeslige, ti igralci imajo na družabnih omrežjih po več deset ali celo sto tisoče sledilcev. Nekaj je moj produkt delilo na omrežjih in smo prek njih pridobil nekaj naročil,« še pove o tem, kako se dober glas širi (tudi) po medmrežju.
text:
Martin's star protectors
The former young football team was not happy with the shields, so he decided to make them himself. He is becoming a player in the global market.
01 Nov 2019, 11:27 by Drago Perko



Martin plays football and works point guards. PHOTO: PERSONAL ARCHIVE M. Š.



Also, captain of the women's national team Mate Zver swears by Martin's products. PHOTO: PERSONAL ARCHIVE M. Š.



Actresses and actors choose different motives. PHOTO: PERSONAL ARCHIVE M. Š.


Footballers and footballers are well aware of the importance of quarterbacks, but it is probably not so well known that Martin Šušteršič, a former young Slovenian national team, also makes them. Not just for yourself and your friends, but for the whole world!


Also, captain of the women's national team Mate Zver swears by Martin's products. PHOTO: PERSONAL ARCHIVE M. Š.

“I was never really happy with the ones I wore. They were fat, cumbersome, heavy, they obstructed me during the game, they did not stay in any way. At the age of fourteen I started making improvised ones. I tried all possible materials and shapes and over the years the shields got better. That's how it started, "the 26-year-old actor, who originally played in Carniola Triglav, tells us now kicks off in Austria (on the ATUS Ferlach team).
Curious baby
“I have always been interested in how things work, so as a kid I used to disassemble and assemble electronic appliances and other things that lay at home, I think I got my first hand skills here. Our guards are handmade, so they require exceptional precision and, above all, patience. It took me over two years to develop the product, while I tested countless different materials and crazy ideas and learned a lot. From the Arsenal to PortlandSead Kolašinac (Arsenal), Milot Rashica, Niclas Fülkrug, Leonardo Bittencourt (all Werder Bremen), Jean Mayer helped me with their development. (US Lecce), Adam Nestmberg Cherin (FC Nuremberg), Jan Mlakar (QPR), Lovro Bizjak (FC Ufa), Blaz Kramer (FC Zurich), Marko Rog (Cagliari), Aljaz Ivacic (Portland Timbers), Senijad Ibricic, Rudi Pozega Vancas, Blaz Vrhovec, Mario Jurcevic, Slobodan Vuk, Tadej Vidmajer, Gregor Sikosek, Aljaz Krefl, Tilen Mlakar, Jean Benedicic, Tom Zurga, Kristjan Arh Cesen, Goran Brkic, Luka Bobicanec, Klemen Sturm are some of the names that use Martin's protectors . »4kickerz football pads are handmade. The manufacture of personalized visors is very specific. Most of the time (more than half) is spent designing (graphics). Depending on the complexity of the design desired by the client, it takes an hour and a half to two and a half hours to produce one pair of protectors, "he says.
Smart foam
We have learned that another company is engaged in the manufacture of shields on request in Slovenia. Their company makes them from carbon based on 3D foot scanning. “Unlike conventional rigid and rigid shields, ours are made of smart foam called the XRD ledge. Its special feature is that the molecules are pressed together when they hit the foam and the foam from the soft and flexible state becomes hard at the instant and absorbs the impact force. Because the guards are flexible in their normal state, they perfectly adapt to the foot of the footballer, so he has the feeling that he is not wearing them at all, and I think that's the key to why more and more players from the best football clubs and leagues want him, "he says. , why his are something special.Family, symbols, animalsToys and players have different desires for what they would like to have in them. Many of them give a picture of their family and friends, they use a variety of symbols, animals, motivational rivers, numbers, dates to enhance their design. The company that makes this foam has presented its idea, and although they do not actually produce such small quantities, support! On the inside, they use special goods on which a special 3D-printed material is printed to prevent the shields from sliding across the leg. "The 4kickerz are one of the easiest football protectors on the market," Martin emphasizes, saying that several companies and people have helped him develop. Currently, about eighty percent of the work is done alone.
Out of hobby business
"If this goes on, I will need a lot of help soon," he said optimistically. “At this point, I can already say that the project has outgrown the hobby, but I do not feel like it is my job as I enjoy it immensely. Almost every week I get a new impetus and motivation when world-famous football players call me up to want to try out my quarterbacks. They were commissioned by Mesut Özil last week so I really don't know where the boundary of my project is at all, "he is justifiably proud.
$ 40-80 costs shields.
“For now, the voice about our visors is spreading mainly from word of mouth. When someone orders them from the team, we usually get 3, 4 orders from her. The great advantage is that they are carried by football players from the English Preimer League and the German Bundesliga, these players have on the social networks of tens or even hundreds of thousands of followers. Some of my product was shared on the networks and we got some orders through them, "he goes on to say about how good voice spreads (even) across the Internet.
